TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PublicKey extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a certificate's public key information. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The PublicKey object contains the object identifier (<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.PublicKey.Oid%2A>) representing the public key algorithm, the ASN-encoded parameters, and the ASN.1-encoded key value.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the public key from a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> object to encrypt a file. It also shows how to decrypt the encrypted file using the private key for that certificate.
[!code-vb[X509Certificate2#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.crypto_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[X509Certificate2#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.crypto_1_1.cs)]
The following example creates a command-line executable that takes a certificate file as an argument and prints various certificate properties to the console.
[!code-cpp[CertInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.crypto_1_2.cpp)] [!code-cs[CertInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.crypto_1_2.cs)] [!code-vb[CertInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.crypto_1_2.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.Oid oid, class System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData parameters, class System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData keyValue) cil managed

Docs.param: An object identifier (OID) object that represents the public key.
An ASN.1-encoded representation of the public key parameters.
An ASN.1-encoded representation of the public key value.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using an object identifier (OID) object of the public key, an ASN.1-encoded representation of the public key parameters, and an ASN.1-encoded representation of the public key value.
Gets the ASN.1-encoded representation of the public key value.
Docs.value: The ASN.1-encoded representation of the public key value.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example creates a command-line executable that takes a certificate file as an argument and prints various certificate properties to the console.
[!code-cpp[CertInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.security.crypto_1_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[CertInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.security.crypto_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[CertInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.security.crypto_1_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the ASN.1-encoded representation of the public key parameters.
Docs.value: The ASN.1-encoded representation of the public key parameters.

Docs.summary: Gets an or object representing the public key.
Docs.value: An object representing the public key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property returns the public key. Both <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSA> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.DSA> keys are supported. Call this property to obtain a certificate's public key. Repeated calls to this property will return the same key.
## Examples The following code example opens the current user certificate store, selects only active certificates, and then allows the user to select one or more certificates. The example then writes certificate information to the console.
[!code-vb[CertSelect#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.security.crypto_119_1.vb)] [!code-cs[CertSelect#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.security.crypto_119_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[CertSelect#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.security.crypto_119_1.cpp)]

Docs.exception: The key algorithm is not supported.

Docs.summary: Gets an object identifier (OID) object of the public key.
Docs.value: An object identifier (OID) object of the public key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An object identifier (OID) is a number that uniquely identifies an object class or attribute. An object identifier is represented as a dotted decimal string, such as "1.2.3.4." Object identifiers are organized into a global hierarchy. National registration authorities issue root object identifiers to individuals or organizations, who manage the hierarchy of OIDs grouped below their root object identifier.
## Examples The following code example creates a command-line executable that takes a certificate file as an argument and prints various certificate properties to the console.
[!code-cpp[CertInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.security.crypto_24_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[CertInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.security.crypto_24_1.cs)] [!code-vb[CertInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.security.crypto_24_1.vb)]
